issue.title: Update the pencil icon language
issue.body: As is brought up in [the community forum](https://github.community/t5/GitHub-Learning-Lab/Where-s-the-pencil-icon/m-p/26081#M854), next time we audit this course, we should change the instructions away from "pencil icon" and into something more generic so that it applies to versions of GitHub with the pencil icon and with the `...` hamburger menu.

issue.title: Fixing hard-coded org reference
issue.body:
`githubtraining` was hard-coded.  This does not make it very friendly to GHES where you can install on any org.  Thank you to @JasonEtco for giving me the proper variable to pull for this.

/cc @crichID @brianamarie @hectorsector @JasonEtco

issue.title: Revert "Add issue triage action"
Add issue triage action
issue.body:
Adds the issue triage action. This should be ready to go just needs an 👀 -- feel free to merge without me.

Main tracking issue: https://github.com/github/learning-lab-content/issues/14

issue.title: Spanish + Japanese localized versions ready for release
issue.body: Latest translations for the Spanish and Japanese version of Introduction to GitHub. Now with translated steps as well 🎉

issue.title: Preparing this repo for OSS
issue.body:
We are preparing this repository for open source!

To do so, we need to:

- [x] Move the existing README content to course-details.md
- [x] Add the README (Points to Code of Conduct and CONTRIBUTING guide in the community-contributors repo)
- [x] Add a LICENSE file

issue.title: QA work
issue.body:
Goals:

- [x] Allow any valid filename, not just `0000-01-02-name.md`
- [x] Fix https://github.com/github/learning-lab/issues/1262

issue.title: Update event from deployment to page_build
issue.body: In response to https://github.com/github/learning-engineering/issues/515

issue.title: Update URLs to be correct on GHES
issue.body:
This PR updates the URLs for several responses so they will also work on GHES.

cc @JasonEtco as this uses the new `{{ repoUrl }}` variable. 
cc @githubtraining/learning-engineering, @githubtraining/trainers

issue.title: Add server installation notes
issue.body: Adds GHES installation notes, per https://github.com/github/learning-engineering/issues/514

issue.title: Course audit
issue.body:
To do:

- [x] Usage/metrics check - are people taking/completing the course? If not, why?
- [x] Is the course description still accurate? Does it follow current conventions?
- [x] Is the course working as expected - both happy and unhappy path?
- [x] Is the content in the course still accurate?
- [x] Are there new learnings/bot actions we can apply with regards to clarity of flow, content or instructions?
- [x] Based on course feedback or our unhappy path testing, can we provide new/additional helper responses to the user?
- [x] Are there new GitHub features that have been released that should be covered in the course?
- [x] Are there new courses/resources we should be cross-referencing in the final issue?
- [x] How can any open issues in the course or template repositories be addressed?
- [x] Review the [course backlog](https://github.com/github/services-training/projects/22#column-3804805) for opportunities to augment the course with a course preference. For example: Introduction to GitHub benefitted from a course preference that allows learners to use CLI or GitHub UI. 
- [x] Is there information you can add to the course's README, tags, or other content that help make it more discoverable? For example: _Create a release based workflow_ goes over branch protections in details, so "protected branches" and "CODEOWNERS" would be good tags to add.
- [x] Ensure all commits in the template repo are created by @githubteacher. 

Closes #11.

issue.title: Add a note about themes
issue.body:
If a learner tries to add a theme, the protected branch will block them from continuing. Let's update the course so we either explicitly say that they should not add a theme, or add some feedback to the response helping them troubleshoot if they try.

When fixed:
- [ ] update [community forum](https://github.community/t5/GitHub-Learning-Lab/Yaml-error-in-Introduction-to-GitHub-Step-2-Turn-On-GitHub-Pages/m-p/14757#M389), the source of the request

issue.title: Fixing Link Text
issue.body:
Fixing a couple definition links.  They are now pictures of books like all the other links

cc @hectorsector, @crichID

issue.title: Display only real branch name, not "refs/heads"
issue.body: While going through learning lab with the participants in training this week, I saw that when opening a pull request, it shows "refs/heads" in addition to the branch name. This pull request **attempts** to fix that. I haven't tested locally so I would ❤️ some review if anyone has time to get to it before I do. cc @hectorsector @githubtraining/learning-engineering

issue.title: WIP: Add a CLI course pref
issue.body: Related to [the backlog](https://github.com/github/services-training/projects/22#card-14851059).

issue.title: There is no pencil icon for editing PR descriptions.
issue.body:
It's now in an expanding context menu. I just updated the copy to reflect this change.

![There is no spoon. Or pencil.](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/521866/46463843-323ad000-c7c5-11e8-9d7f-616208b81c48.png)

issue.title: Remove order
issue.body: Removes the order key from the config file

issue.title: Update config.yml to latest schema
issue.body: Towards github/services-training#870

issue.title: Replace text with book
issue.body: @crichID please merge if this looks good!

issue.title: Update creating a pull request instructions
issue.body:
@JasonEtco using {{ branch }} includes refs/heads/BRANCHNAME as opposed to just BRANCHNAME. 

Example: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13326548/42924491-4beb72a2-8adf-11e8-8f91-f07f997257f7.png)


Is there a way for us to edit this before merging? If not, please feel free to merge directly.

issue.title: Add GitHub Pages URL
issue.body: Adds the GitHub Pages URL to a response in Step 3.

issue.title: Improvements to course description and meta
issue.body: This PR beefs up the course description and other elements in the course.

issue.title: Fix merged check
issue.body: Fixes #1 by adjusting the `gate` action to check for `payload.pull_request.merged` instead of just `merged` (which doesn't exist so is `undefined`, so `falsey`, so the gate doesn't pass and the step can't be completed).
